knowledges_ids.K0001: Knowledge of computer networking concepts and protocols, and network security methodologies.

knowledges_ids.K0002: Knowledge of risk management processes (e.g., methods for assessing and mitigating risk).

knowledges_ids.K0003: Knowledge of laws, regulations, policies, and ethics as they relate to cybersecurity and privacy.

knowledges_ids.K0004: Knowledge of cybersecurity and privacy principles.

knowledges_ids.K0005: Knowledge of cyber threats and vulnerabilities.

knowledges_ids.K0006: Knowledge of specific operational impacts of cybersecurity lapses.

knowledges_ids.K0008: Knowledge of applicable business processes and operations of customer organizations.

knowledges_ids.K0012: Knowledge of capabilities and requirements analysis.

knowledges_ids.K0019: Knowledge of cryptography and cryptographic key management concepts

knowledges_ids.K0035: Knowledge of installation, integration, and optimization of system components.

knowledges_ids.K0038: Knowledge of cybersecurity and privacy principles used to manage risks related to the use, processing, storage, and transmission of information or data.

knowledges_ids.K0043: Knowledge of industry-standard and organizationally accepted analysis principles and methods.

knowledges_ids.K0044: Knowledge of cybersecurity and privacy principles and organizational requirements (relevant to confidentiality, integrity, availability, authentication, non-repudiation).

knowledges_ids.K0045: Knowledge of information security systems engineering principles (NIST SP 800-160).

knowledges_ids.K0047: Knowledge of information technology (IT) architectural concepts and frameworks.

knowledges_ids.K0056: Knowledge of network access, identity, and access management (e.g., public key infrastructure, Oauth, OpenID, SAML, SPML).

knowledges_ids.K0059: Knowledge of new and emerging information technology (IT) and cybersecurity technologies.

knowledges_ids.K0061: Knowledge of how traffic flows across the network (e.g., Transmission Control Protocol [TCP] and Internet Protocol [IP], Open System Interconnection Model [OSI], Information Technology Infrastructure Library, current version [ITIL]).

knowledges_ids.K0063: Knowledge of parallel and distributed computing concepts.

knowledges_ids.K0073: Knowledge of secure configuration management techniques.

knowledges_ids.K0074: Knowledge of key concepts in security management (e.g., Release Management, Patch Management).

knowledges_ids.K0086: Knowledge of system design tools, methods, and techniques, including automated systems analysis and design tools.

knowledges_ids.K0087: Knowledge of system software and organizational design standards, policies, and authorized approaches (e.g., International Organization for Standardization [ISO] guidelines) relating to system design.

knowledges_ids.K0090: Knowledge of system life cycle management principles, including software security and usability.

knowledges_ids.K0091: Knowledge of systems testing and evaluation methods.

knowledges_ids.K0093: Knowledge of telecommunications concepts (e.g., Communications channel, Systems Link Budgeting, Spectral efficiency, Multiplexing).

knowledges_ids.K0101: Knowledge of the organization's enterprise information technology (IT) goals and objectives.

knowledges_ids.K0102: Knowledge of the systems engineering process.

knowledges_ids.K0126: Knowledge of Supply Chain Risk Management Practices (NIST SP 800-161)

knowledges_ids.K0163: Knowledge of critical information technology (IT) procurement requirements.

knowledges_ids.K0164: Knowledge of functionality, quality, and security requirements and how these will apply to specific items of supply (i.e., elements and processes).

knowledges_ids.K0168: Knowledge of applicable laws, statutes (e.g., in Titles 10,18,32,50 in U.S. Code), Presidential Directives, executive branch guidelines, and/or administrative/criminal legal guidelines and procedures.

knowledges_ids.K0169: Knowledge of information technology (IT) supply chain security and supply chain risk management policies, requirements, and procedures.

knowledges_ids.K0170: Knowledge of critical infrastructure systems with information communication technology that were designed without system security considerations.

knowledges_ids.K0180: Knowledge of network systems management principles, models, methods (e.g., end-to-end systems performance monitoring), and tools.

knowledges_ids.K0200: Knowledge of service management concepts for networks and related standards (e.g., Information Technology Infrastructure Library, current version [ITIL]).

knowledges_ids.K0267: Knowledge of laws, policies, procedures, or governance relevant to cybersecurity for critical infrastructures.

knowledges_ids.K0287: Knowledge of an organization's information classification program and procedures for information compromise.

knowledges_ids.K0325: Knowledge of Information Theory (e.g., source coding, channel coding, algorithm complexity theory, and data compression).

knowledges_ids.K0332: Knowledge of network protocols such as TCP/IP, Dynamic Host Configuration, Domain Name System (DNS), and directory services.

knowledges_ids.K0333: Knowledge of network design processes, to include understanding of security objectives, operational objectives, and trade-offs.

knowledges_ids.K0622: Knowledge of controls related to the use, processing, storage, and transmission of data.

skills_ids.S0005: Skill in applying and incorporating information technologies into proposed solutions.

skills_ids.S0006: Skill in applying confidentiality, integrity, and availability principles.

skills_ids.S0008: Skill in applying organization-specific systems analysis principles and techniques.

skills_ids.S0010: Skill in conducting capabilities and requirements analysis.

skills_ids.S0050: Skill in design modeling and building use cases (e.g., unified modeling language).

skills_ids.S0134: Skill in conducting reviews of systems.

skills_ids.S0367: Skill to apply cybersecurity and privacy principles to organizational requirements (relevant to confidentiality, integrity, availability, authentication, non-repudiation).

abilities_ids.A0064: Ability to interpret and translate customer requirements into operational capabilities.

abilities_ids.A0123: Ability to apply cybersecurity and privacy principles to organizational requirements (relevant to confidentiality, integrity, availability, authentication, non-repudiation).

abilities_ids.A0170: Ability to identify critical infrastructure systems with information communication technology that were designed without system security considerations.

tasks_ids.T0033: Conduct risk analysis, feasibility study, and/or trade-off analysis to develop, document, and refine functional requirements and specifications.

tasks_ids.T0039: Consult with customers to evaluate functional requirements.

tasks_ids.T0045: Coordinate with systems architects and developers, as needed, to provide oversight in the development of design solutions.

tasks_ids.T0052: Define project scope and objectives based on customer requirements.

tasks_ids.T0062: Develop and document requirements, capabilities, and constraints for design procedures and processes.

tasks_ids.T0127: Integrate and align information security and/or cybersecurity policies to ensure that system analysis meets security requirements.

tasks_ids.T0156: Oversee and make recommendations regarding configuration management.

tasks_ids.T0174: Perform needs analysis to determine opportunities for new and improved business process solutions.

tasks_ids.T0191: Prepare use cases to justify the need for specific information technology (IT) solutions.

tasks_ids.T0235: Translate functional requirements into technical solutions.

tasks_ids.T0273: Develop and document supply chain risks for critical system elements, as appropriate.

tasks_ids.T0300: Develop and document User Experience (UX) requirements including information architecture and user interface requirements.

tasks_ids.T0325: Document a system's purpose and preliminary system security concept of operations.

tasks_ids.T0334: Ensure that all systems components can be integrated and aligned (e.g., procedures, databases, policies, software, and hardware).

tasks_ids.T0454: Define baseline security requirements in accordance with applicable guidelines.

tasks_ids.T0463: Develop cost estimates for new or modified system(s).

tasks_ids.T0497: Manage the information technology (IT) planning process to ensure that developed solutions meet customer requirements.
